title: Understanding Work Done in Thermodynamics
text: In thermodynamics, work done by the system during an expansion can be computed based on the pressure and the change in volume.

title: Formula for Work Done
text: Recall that work W done by a gas when it is expanded or compressed at constant pressure P can be calculated using the formula: W=P(V_f-V_i, where $$V_i$$ is the initial volume and $$V_f$$ is the final volume.

title: Calculating the Change in Volume
text: What is the change in volume $$V_f-V_i$$ given $$V_i=542L$$ and $$V_f=974L$$?

title: Calculate Work Done in Latm
text: Using the pressure $$P=50.0atm$$ and change in volume $$ΔV=432L$$, find work done in Latm.

title: Converting $$L atm$$ to Joules
text: $$1$$ Latm equals $$101.3$$ J. Use this conversion to express the work done in joules.

title: Compute Work Done in Joules
text: Compute the work done using (21600 L*atm)*(101.3J/L*atm).
